title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Hello , 

I got this macbook that came in today , the issue is  its not booting , when i plug it  i can see the orange light   , fan spins then battery signs appear but no boot , i disconnected the battery and the same is happening , can i get some help  please ? 

Thank you very much .

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Be sure to get 85W Magsafe 2 charger.
Also test with known good battery.
This board will not always boot with improper battery.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I did test with  85W Magsafe 2 charger.  i did get a boot without the battery connected , but as soon as i connected the battery it would not give me any orange light ,  would that have anything to ee with the battery ?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
You've said to get amber lighr in first post with battery connected.
The light must come on with charger alone too (without battery).

BTW, do not connect/reconnect battery, when charger is plugged in; you risk to fry the SMC.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: right , but using a 45W Charger , but with the 85W i would not get any light when battery is connected , but with battery disconnected i do get orange light and a boot. No i always disconnect first before connecting battery.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
I wanted to give you a clear information about the behaviour of the macbook, 

with 45 W i got orange light with battery connected but no boot , with 85W magafe 2 i do have a boot without battery disconnected , now i do not have a known good battery here to make a test , would you suggest me to get a know good battery to test ?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Should be the best option, known good battery.
This board will not start with 45/60W charger alone; unless charged battery is also connected.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Will try that and keep you updated, Thank you so much for your help.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
I order a battery but i think that i got the wrong one , the original that the laptop came in with   is  11.36V 99.5Wh 8755mAh Battery 
but what i received is :11.26V Capacity: 95Wh / 8440mAh Battery , when I tested it , I got no boot , and not charging , does it mean that i have to get exactly the : 11.36V 99.5Wh 8755mAh Battery  ? 

Please advice  thank you very much .

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Can you test this battery with good working board?
Many crap batteries sold by chinese...

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I dont have another board like it here , but  I just ordered another battery , cause that battery is indeed made in shengzen china . I will have to wait again , i am not even getting the orange light with that battery connected.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
I just got the other battery with brand new with the correct infos comparing to the one that the computer came with , but still the same , not boot , no orange light with battery connected , its like the computer is not reading  batteries or i am not sure if this is another bad quality  or could it be the charging IC , cause the owner stated that before it used to charge only when it used to be off , would that be the charging IC U7000 ? 

Please advice , thank you very much .

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Post PPBUS_G3H voltage w/ and w/o battery connected.
Are you using original 85W Magsafe 2 charger now?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Yes , the charger is original   85W Magsafe 2

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I also got two notifications , one is saying that memory is too low to empty some stuffs , second is asking for software update , can any of that be part of  the issue  by any chance?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
So machine boots with both charger and battery connected now?

Disconnect internal SSD and boot with another preinstalled USB macOS.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: No , Machine boots with its old battery but still not charging , but as soon as  I disconnect old battery and preinstall the new battery   no boot , no orange light  with charger connected. , I do not have a preinstalled USB macOS here.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Looks like new battery is also crap.
Without any battery connected (only charger), do you get amber light?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: without battery connected , I got orange light and normal boot.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: The problem is , I do not have another original pulled battery from another macbook like this one , but according to your expertise , the charging IC U7000  would not be the culprit?  I can not blame it 100% cause my one wire circuit is working .

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: If the machine still started with original battery, then I will suspect the new batteries...

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I have made a few tests as well ,  for instance if i disconnect the battery and plug charging cable it powers on , but then even with the original battery sometimes if i disconnect and connect the battery then  connect the charger  it would not even give him the orange light , so i have to connect it again without battery to get a boot then shut it down then it would give me a boot with the original old battery with the  charger connected of course , but with the new battery  connected i got nothing , no amber lights , no boot , Nothing at all.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Then get known good original battery, even old, for test.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Yes I ordered one used pulled one so as soon as i get i will install it to see.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I got an original pulled battery from another working macbook , and still  not charging ,  no boot  and no orange light .

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Do you have original 85W Magsafe 2 charger?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: Yes i do

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Try another DCIN board.
This board will not turn on without Magsafe light.
Post U7000 voltages.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I do not have another board , The battery that i got was from another computer but was shipped to me from California, so i do not have another board of the same type here, should i replace U7000 By a new one?

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
"Post U7000 voltages."
Check continuity between U7000 and central pin of Magsafe connector.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: ok , will do that

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I did what you said , and this is what i came up with , U7100  was shorted,  So I changed it and its charging , but sometimes it stops and i have to reconnect it again , I believe the magsafe connector  also needs changing, I will inform the customer about that as well.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: For instance , if it goes on sleep mode with magsafe charger connected , as soon as i press any key to wake it up , it would immediately stop charging then  I have to disconnect and reconnect it again , if i type password to unlock device  it does that too , what might've caused that kinda behaviour, and magsafe charger got very hot while charging.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message:
Should be good to try known good DCIN board.
Also check SMC_LID level, if stable.

title: MACBOOK A1398  820-00163-A No Boot
message: I will check the   SMC_LID level,
